title: Basic Grade Medical Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mater Misericordiae University Hospital (Dublin, Dublin) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview was setup with a waiting area and the interview was punctual on the day. Technical knowledge and competency questions were assessed. Excellent structured interview. Was timed to be concise & had time to answer the questions well.
Interview Questions: What are the top traits you possess for this position.

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Mater Misericordiae University Hospital
Interview Descriptions:
45 minute call with line manager and HR. Competency’ based questions. Scenarios provided to show how you would prioritise ill patients
It was over the phone in covid times. They ask you preference for area of work whether its medical or sugrical
Interview Questions: Patient with obvious signs of sepsis, blood transfusion allergy and high EWS

title: Oncology Nurse Navigator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mater Misericordiae University Hospital (Dublin, Dublin)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is comprehensive. Experience and qualifications of candidates does not matter. The interview procedure has something wrong in selecting individuals. Sometimes  people feel candidates are preselected already.  Some questions are given to the staff and some others do not even know what would be ask. Managers give answers to candidates so there is a huge room for biases.  Candidates need to answer specific examples not just concepts.
Interview Questions: What is your idea about the job?

title: Clerical Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mater Misericordiae University Hospital (Dublin, Dublin)
Interview Descriptions: Made feel very comfortable. Interviewers very friendly and reassuring, explained the job description in detail and asked how I would fit each aspect, asked about working under pressure. I applied online and was called for interview a week later
Interview Questions: How would you suit this position

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Mater Misericordiae University Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was pretty straightforward..submitted cv, had formal interview with HR and other managers..very friendly and made the whole process less daunting. Overall I felt very comfortable and quite supported.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your cv, former experience, also gave scenarios applicable to the job I was going for.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Mater Misericordiae University Hospital (Dublin, Dublin) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, got interview invitation after around 3 weeks. The interview panel of 4 people, all very nice and wanted you to do good, interview results only after 3-4 weeks after the interview.
Interview Questions: How did you prepare for the interview, what would you do it X situation, give an example when you worked well with a team, Things going bad scenario - what are the steps you would take and why, etc. Nothing surprising

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Mater Misericordiae University Hospital (Dublin, Dublin) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Hiring is long - no funding towards the end of the year. Very few external advertisements. Most positions are usually lined up prior to interview. It's very much who you know not what you know here. Many people are related to one another etc

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Mater Misericordiae University Hospital (Dublin, Dublin) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview went quite well. I was asked about my current job and describe what is it that i do. I was also asked how can i implement my current knowledge and skill to a new job. Last but not least i was asked certain skills i have learned during my college years.
Interview Questions: How to apply my current experience in my actual job to a new job.

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mater Misericordiae University Hospital (Dublin, Dublin) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions:
I was interviewed by 3 People
I found it intense
A lot of Q's were asked quite quickly
I was very nervous
There were 4 others waiting with me to be interviewed
A very brief introduction was made by the panel and I felt very unsettled and found it hard to concentrate

title: Medical SHO Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Mater Misericordiae University Hospital (Dublin, Dublin) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job through the royal College of Physicians of Irelands website. I was given an interview time and date within a few weeks of applying. I was interviewed in Beaumont hospital along with other candidates. I was contacted by email with the outcome within a few weeks of applying.
Interview Questions: What have you seen working abroad that you think would improve the Irish Health system?
